topic.title: Install the HP Helion Development Platform

ol.li:
You will need the following pieces of information in order to run the service updates.
Identifier Description
DEPLOYER IP address of the Deployer.
USERNAME The OpenStack username of a cloud admin that has rights to perform a service update for the selected service.
PASSWORD The OpenStack password of a cloud admin that has rights to perform a service update for the selected service.

Manually set ownership of the bin folder. [This is an extra step required for the beta release.]
SSH to the Deployer node using admin credentials.
On the Deployer, find the /etc/hosts file, which lists all of the cloud hosts. Identify the three cloud management nodes; they will look similar to the following:cat /etc/hosts | grep c1-m1-mgmt cat /etc/hosts | grep c1-m2-mgmt cat /etc/hosts | grep c1-m3-mgmt
SSH to each of those three management nodes with admin credentials and run the following commands on each one:sudo chown -r horizon-venv /opt/stack/services/horizon/venv/bin sudo chown -r horizon-venv /opt/stack/services/horizon/venv/lib

section.title: Step 2. Download the Latest Version of HP Helion Development Platform
section.p: The installation of the HP Helion Development Platform for HP Helion OpenStack is provided as a small compressed tar file. The images for the individual services will be downloaded at the installer's request.

ol.li: Navigate to the the HP Helion Download Network (HDN) and log in. If necessary, create an account first.
Download the Development Platform Installer 2.0.0.0 beta package.

section.title: Step 3. Download and Install the Python Scripts

ol.li: Verify that you have access to the pypi site. If ping is unavailable, use wget.ping pypi.python.org
Install python-virtualenv sudo apt-get install python-virtualenv
Install python-dev sudo apt-get install python-dev

section.title: Step 4. Install the HP Helion Development Platform
section.note: For help with the installer, enter the command openstack hdpi

ol.li: If your network uses a proxy, it may be necessary to set the https_proxy and http_proxy shell variables so that the installer may download required Python libraries from the pypi site. To set the shell variables, enter the following commands: export https_proxy={ip address or url of https proxy} export http_proxy={ip address or url of http proxy} Example: export https_proxy=http://proxy.example.com export http_proxy=http://proxy.example.com

If your network uses a proxy, you must define the proxy exclusion list. Enter the following command: export no_proxy=localhost,127.0.0.1, <ip address or host name of identity service aka keystone> Example: export no_proxy=localhost,127.0.0.1,10.0.0.10
Install the Development Platform Installer in the Virtual Environment .pip install DevelopmentPlatformInstaller.2.0.0.0.tar.gz
